Next up is Chris Jackson. He was drafted in the 1st round, 3rd pick of the 1990 draft by the Nuggets. Again, this is a first-round pick, so another player who fits the claim.

Now, looking at Chris Mills. His NBA Draft entry states he was selected in the 1st round, 22nd pick of the 1993 draft by the Cavs. That's still within the first round, so that works too.

Billy Owens was picked in the 1st round, 3rd pick of the 1991 draft by the Kings. So another first-round selection here as well.

Finally, Kenny Williams' NBA Draft information shows he was taken in the 2nd round, 46th pick of the 1990 draft by the Pacers. This is not a first-round pick because the second round comes after the first. 

So out of five players, four were selected in the first round (Alonzo Mourning, Chris Jackson, Chris Mills, Billy Owens), and only one was not (Kenny Williams). Therefore, the claim that "all but 1" were selected in their first round draft is TRUE.

To support this conclusion, I need to list the relevant cells from each player's row. Each of them has an NBA Draft column which indicates whether they were picked in the first round or not. So for each row (0 through 4), the "nba draft" column is relevant.
</think>
